page.title: 07RELIGION
page.content: There are two churches serving Elham and Acrise. St Mary the Virgin, dating from 1180, and St Martins at Acrise. The church in Elham has three Sunday services: 8.15am Holy Communion (said) 9.30am Parish Eucharist and Sunday school, 6.30pm Evening prayer and address. During the week the church is open during daylight hours for prayer and meditation. Morning prayers are said Monday to Saturday at 9.00am. A Eucharist is celebrated every Thursday at 11am and on Saints days at 7pm. The vicar will always take communion to the homes of sick people. The church plays an active role in the life of the school. The school is Church of England aided. The church of St Martins, Acrise is administered by the vicar of Hawkinge and sevices are held every Sunday.
